greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Highest exponent in the prime factorization of n^n
link: Amiram Eldar, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: a(n) = n * A051903(n). - _Franklin T. Adams-Watters_, Mar 29 2011
mathematica: Join[{0}, Table[n*Max[Last /@ FactorInteger[n]], {n, 2, 100}]] (* _T. D. Noe_, Mar 30 2011 *)
results.author: _A. Timothy Royappa_, Mar 29 2011
